properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 9:17AM AKST until January 12 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow occurring. Visibility will be
one half mile at less at times. Travel will be very difficult
to impossible. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches,
with localized amounts up to 12 inches, are expected. Snow will
accumulate into large drifts.

* WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM Sunday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause
areas of blowing and drifting snow. Visibility will be one half
mile or less at times. Conditions will improve briefly this
afternoon as snow diminishes, but then will rapidly deteriorate
this evening as more snow moves into the area.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe
winter weather conditions are occurring. This will make travel
very difficult or impossible.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST SUNDAY
